wikipedia_page.main: Prof Edward Lindsay Ince FRSE (30 November 1891 – 16 March 1941) was a British mathematician who worked on differential equations, especially those with periodic coefficients such as the Mathieu equation and the Lamé equation. He introduced the Ince equation, a generalization of the  Mathieu equation.

response: *Edward Lindsay Ince FRSE mathematician, born and raised here
*Edward Lindsay Ince  – Mathematician, SRC Senior President.
